message: Hello Bob! I'm excited to offer you this amazing product. I think it's a great fit for you, and I'm willing to sell it to you for $110. What do you think?
I appreciate your offer, Alice, but I was thinking more along the lines of $90. Would you be willing to meet me halfway?
Thank you for your offer, Bob. I understand you're looking for a good deal, but I'm not willing to go as low as $90. I'm willing to compromise and offer it to you for $100. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to compromise, Alice, but I'm still a bit above my budget. Would you be willing to meet me at $95?

I understand you're trying to stay within your budget, Bob. However, I'm still looking to make a profit. I'm willing to meet you at $98. It's a fair compromise, considering the product's value to you. What do you think?
I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Alice, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. Would you be willing to go down to $92?
I'm still not willing to go as low as $92, Bob. However, I'm willing to make one more compromise. I'll meet you at $99. It's the lowest I can go and still make a profit. What do you think?
I understand you're trying to make a profit, Alice, but I'm really close to walking away. I'm willing to meet you at $96. This is my final offer. If you can't accept, I'll have to look elsewhere.

I understand you're close to walking away, Bob, but I'm not willing to give up yet. I'll meet you halfway between $99 and $96. I'll sell the product to you for $97. This is my final offer. If you can't accept, I'll have to consider other options.
I appreciate your persistence, Alice, but I've reached my limit. I'm going to have to pass on this offer. I'll consider buying the product from John for $80 instead.
